src:
Ekspor Kopi Jabar Berpeluang Meningkat
02 Nov 2019, 01:47 by Yulistyne Kasumaningrum
BANDUNG, (PR).- Ekspor komoditas kopi Indonesia, khususnya Jawa Barat masih sangat berpeluang untuk ditingkatkan. Saat ini dari sekitar 600-700 ton kopi yang dihasilkan baru sekitar 50-60% kopi yang diekspor. Padahal, dari sisi kualitas, kopi yang dihasilkan petani tanah air sangat baik dan telah diakui di level dunia.
Ketua Dewan Kopi Nasional Anton Apriyantono mengatakan, secara historis kopi Jabar telah terkenal sejak lama dengan nama Preanger. Bahkan, jika di dunia telah dikenal kopi Java maka sebetulnya merupakan kopi asal Jabar.
Sehingga, sangat memungkinkan bagi Jabar untuk mengembalikan kejayaan komoditas kopinya. Apalagi sejak beberapa tahun lalu, sejak era gubernur Ahmad Heryawan, telah cukup banyak bibit kopi yang disebar untuk ditanam.
“Mulai tahun ini akan terlihat hasilnya, mulai panen. Upaya yang dilakukan untuk mengembalikan dan mengembangkan lebih lanjut kopi Jabar ini sangat bagus, termasuk untuk mendukung ekspor ke banyak negara,” katanya yang ditemui disela Pembukaan West Java Specialty Coffee (WJSC) 2019 di Trans Studi Mall, Bandung, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
West Java Specialty Coffee Festival 2019 diselenggarakan pada tanggal 1-2 November 2019 di Trans Studio Mall Bandung. Tahun ini, kegiatan dilesenggarakan dengan berkolaborasi dengan Specialty Coffee Association of Indonesia dan Asean Coffee Federation (ACF).
Meski tidak mengingat secara detil kinerja ekspor kopi Jabar, Anton menuturkan, secara umum Indonesia merupakan produsen kopi keempat terbesar dunia setelah Brasil, Vietnam, dan Kolombia. Meski secara volume belum besar, tapi secara kualitas kopi Indonesia, khususnya Jabar sangat baik.
“Makanya dengan berbagai upaya yang dilakukan kita harapkan tidak hanya dari sisi kualitas juga akan meningkatkan kuantitas, khususnya produktivitas dengan penanaman baru yang dilakukan,” katanya.
Ketua Specialty Coffee Association of Indonesia Syafrudin menambahkan dengan kolaborasi menjadi kunci penting untuk mengembangkan dan memajukan kopi specialty Jabar. Dengan kolaborasi yang dilakukan diharapkan akan memberikan pengalaman lebih ke petani kopi Jabar untuk meningkatkan kualitas dan produktivitas produknya, termasuk bagaimana memasarkannya.
“Dari dalam sistem specialty, semua benar-benar diolah dari hulu ke hilir secara baik,” katanya.
Kepala Disperindag Jabar Arifin Soedjayana mengatakan industri kopi di Jabar memiliki potensi besar untuk terus dikembangkan karena didukung bahan baku yang berkualitas. Seperti yang diketahui, kopi asal Jabar memiliki memiliki jenis kopi yang beragam dan potensial sebagai komoditas yang menjanjikan di pasar nasional maupun internasional.
Ajang ini diharapkan dapat mendorong peningkatan kualitas dan kuantitas kopi yang ada di Jabar agar dapat sejajar dengan kopi dari daerah dan negara lain di skala internasional. Lebih lanjut, melalui kopi diharapkan akan membawa Jawa Barat mendunia.
“Kita harapkan dengan semua komponen bersatu, saat ini menjadi era kebangkitan kopi Jabar. Bagaimana kopi Jabar tidak kalah dengan provinsi lain,” ujarnya.
Perhelatan West Java Specialty Coffee Festival 2019 meliputi rangkaian program acara, mulai dari pameran, konferensi, kompetisi, dan lelang terkait kopi, hingga hiburan musik. Acara diikuti 37 peserta terdiri dari petani kopi dari berbagai titik perkebunan kopi di Jabar. Kegiatan ini merupakan peluang untuk mempromosikan kopi Jabar ke tingkat nasional dan internasional.
“Besok kami juga akan melakukan lelang dimana juga hadir sejumlah tamu dari negara lain. Mudah-mudahan kopi Jabar semakin bisa diterima di pasar internasional,” katanya.
Salah seorang pengunjung yang merupakan roaster, Jimmy mengaku sangat mengapresiasi kegiatan ini. Ia bahkan menyengajakan diri datang dari Jakarta untuk melihat langsung perkembangan kualitas green bean kopi Jabar.
“Terlihat ada peningkatan dan tentunya bagus sekali dengan adanya kegiatan ini karena kita bisa melihat perkembangannya,” kata Jimmy.***

text:
West Java Coffee Export Potentially Increased
02 Nov 2019, 01:47 by Yulistyne Kasumaningrum
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The export of Indonesian coffee commodities, especially West Java, is still very likely to be increased. Currently, from around 600-700 tons of coffee produced, only about 50-60% of coffee is exported. In fact, in terms of quality, coffee produced by farmers in the country is very good and has been recognized at the world level.
Chairman of the National Coffee Board Anton Apriyantono said, historically West Java coffee has been famous for a long time by the name of Preanger. In fact, if the world is known for Java coffee, it is actually coffee from West Java.
Thus, it is very possible for West Java to restore the glory of its coffee commodity. Especially since a few years ago, since the era of governor Ahmad Heryawan, there have been quite a lot of coffee seeds spread for planting.
"Starting this year the results will be seen, start harvesting. The efforts made to restore and further develop West Java coffee are very good, including to support exports to many countries, "he said when he was interrupted by the opening of the 2019 West Java Specialty Coffee (WJSC) at Trans Studi Mall, Bandung, Friday, November 1, 2019.
West Java Specialty Coffee Festival 2019 is held on November 1-2, 2019 at Trans Studio Mall Bandung. This year, the event was held in collaboration with the Specialty Coffee Association of Indonesia and the Asean Coffee Federation (ACF).
Although not remembering in detail the performance of West Java coffee exports, Anton said, in general Indonesia is the fourth largest coffee producer in the world after Brazil, Vietnam, and Colombia. Even though the volume is not large, the quality of Indonesian coffee, especially West Java, is very good.
"Therefore, with the various efforts carried out, we hope that not only in terms of quality will also increase quantity, especially productivity with new planting," he said.
Chairman of the Specialty Coffee Association of Indonesia Syafrudin added that collaboration is an important key to developing and advancing West Java specialty coffee. The collaboration is expected to provide more experience to West Java coffee farmers to improve the quality and productivity of their products, including how to market them.
"From the specialty system, everything is really processed from upstream to downstream well," he said.
West Java Disperindag Head Arifin Soedjayana said the coffee industry in West Java has great potential to continue to be developed because it is supported by quality raw materials. As is known, coffee from West Java has a variety of types of coffee and potential as a promising commodity in national and international markets.
This event is expected to encourage an increase in the quality and quantity of coffee available in West Java so that it can be parallel with coffee from other regions and countries on an international scale. Furthermore, through coffee is expected to bring West Java worldwide.
"We hope that with all components united, this is the era of the rise of West Java coffee. How is West Java coffee not inferior to other provinces, "he said.
The West Java Specialty Coffee Festival 2019 event includes a series of programs, ranging from exhibitions, conferences, competitions and auctions related to coffee, to music entertainment. The event was attended by 37 participants consisting of coffee farmers from various coffee plantation points in West Java. This activity is an opportunity to promote West Java coffee to the national and international level.
"Tomorrow we will also hold an auction where there will also be a number of guests from other countries. I hope West Java coffee will be more acceptable in the international market, "he said.
One of the visitors who is a roaster, Jimmy admitted that he really appreciated this activity. He even invited himself to come from Jakarta to see firsthand the development of the quality of West Java coffee bean green.
"There seems to be an increase and of course it's great with this activity because we can see its development," Jimmy said. ***
